titleStmt.title: TO THE RIGHT HONOVRABLE MY SINGƲLAR GOOD LORD, SIR THO: EGERTON KNIGHT, Lord Ellesmere; Lord Chancelour of England; Chancelour of the Vniuersitie of Oxford; The sincere and graue Ora∣cle of Equitie; The great & sure friend of the Church; The sanctuarie of the Clergy; The bountifull incou∣rager of Learning, J. H.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: TO THE RIGHT HONOVRABLE MY SINGƲLAR GOOD LORD, SIR THO: EGERTON KNIGHT, Lord Ellesmere; Lord Chancelour of England; Chancelour of the Vniuersitie of Oxford; The sincere and graue Ora∣cle of Equitie; The great & sure friend of the Church; The sanctuarie of the Clergy; The bountifull incou∣rager of Learning, J. H.

monogr.title: Contemplations vpon the principal passages of the holie historie. The third volume: in three bookes. By I. Hall, Doctor of Diuinitie
monogr.author: Hall, Joseph

div.head: TO THE RIGHT HONOVRABLE MY SINGƲLAR GOOD LORD, SIR THO: EGERTON KNIGHT, Lord Ellesmere; Lord Chancelour of England; Chancelour of the Vniuersitie of Oxford; The sincere and graue Oracle of Equitie; The great & sure friend of the Church; The sanctuarie of the Clergy; The bountifull incourager of Learning, J. H.
div.p: With thankfull acknowledgement of Gods blessing vpon this State, in so vvorthy an Instrument, and humble prayers for his happy continuance, Dedicates this poore and vnworthy part of his labors.
